page.title: 02HORTON SCHOOL
page.content: Horton School is a small rural voluntary aided church school.It was built about 1860 and brought up to modern standards in 1982 with the addition of a new classroom and toilet block.Much of this was done by the voluntary help of parents and friends,who also donated a substantial part of the cost.In spite of this the school has been scheduled by the County of Avon Education Committee to close in July 1986.We are currently contesting this and an appeal has been sent to the Secretary of State for Education.The school plays an important part in village life and provides a Christian Primary Education for children of a scattered area around Horton and Little Sodbury. Parents are anxious that small children shall not have a long journey by bus out of their environment.
